snippet: The rules would prohibit banks from buying and selling commodities and would require them to close what’s left of their in-house private equity operations....
abstract: Federal Reserve, Office of the Comptroller of the Currency and Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation release report proposing new regulations to promote safety and soundness of banking system; recommendations would prohibit banks from so-called merchant banking, which usually involves owning private equity-like stakes in outside companies, and from buying and selling commodities; rules, issued in compliance with Dodd-Frank financial reform act, need Congressional approval before they can take effect.
lead_paragraph: The rules would prohibit banks from buying and selling commodities and would require them to close what’s left of their in-house private equity operations.

headline.main: Regulators Seek Tighter Curbs on Investments by Big Banks
headline.print_headline: Regulators Seek Tighter Curbs on Investments by Big Banks With Their Own Money

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
